citations.narrative:
Records of acquisition and disposition were not available for any of the dogs or puppies on hand or sold at the time of
inspection. Failure to provide this information may interfere with the ability of APHIS officials to identify animals and to
trace their movements. Each dealer shall make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose the
required information concerning each dog purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, or otherwise in his or her
possession or under his or her control, or which is transported, euthanized, sold, or otherwise disposed of. These records
shall be maintained on the Record of Acquisition of Dogs and Cats on Hand (APHIS Form 7005) and Record of
Disposition of Dogs and Cats (APHIS Form 7006) and they shall be made available for APHIS inspection.
To be corrected by July 14, 2025

A contingency plan was not available for review at the time of inspection. Contingency plans help to ensure animals
receive proper care during emergency situations. Dealers must develop, document, and follow an appropriate plan to
provide for the humane handling, treatment, transportation, housing, and care of their animals in the event of an
emergency or disaster (one which could reasonably be anticipated and expected to be detrimental to the good health and
well-being of the animals in their possession).
To be corrected by July 14, 2025

A written program of veterinary care was not available for review at the time of inspection. The program of veterinary care
is necessary to ensure all animals are receiving adequate veterinary care to include physical exams, vaccinations,
sampling and treatment of parasites, and preventative care. Each dealer must keep and maintain the written program and
make it available for APHIS inspection.
To be corrected by July 14, 2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.75(a)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
Records of acquisition and disposition were not available for any of the dogs or puppies on hand or sold at the time of 
inspection. Failure to provide this information may interfere with the ability of APHIS officials to identify animals and to 
trace their movements. Each dealer shall make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose the 
required information concerning each dog purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, or otherwise in his or her 
possession or under his or her control, or which is transported, euthanized, sold, or otherwise disposed of. These records 
shall be maintained on the Record of Acquisition of Dogs and Cats on Hand (APHIS Form 7005) and Record of 
Disposition of Dogs and Cats (APHIS Form 7006) and they shall be made available for APHIS inspection. 
To be corrected by July 14, 2025 
2.134(a) 
   
Contingency planning. 
A contingency plan was not available for review at the time of inspection. Contingency plans help to ensure animals 
receive proper care during emergency situations. Dealers must develop, document, and follow an appropriate plan to 
provide for the humane handling, treatment, transportation, housing, and care of their animals in the event of an 
emergency or disaster (one which could reasonably be anticipated and expected to be detrimental to the good health and 
well-being of the animals in their possession). 
To be corrected by July 14, 2025 
3.13(a) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
A written program of veterinary care was not available for review at the time of inspection. The program of veterinary care 
is necessary to ensure all animals are receiving adequate veterinary care to include physical exams, vaccinations, 
sampling and treatment of parasites, and preventative care. Each dealer must keep and maintain the written program and 
make it available for APHIS inspection. 
To be corrected by July 14, 2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
